extendedInfo.description: Supported Services:  - Feedly Cloud (http://cloud.feedly.com/) - The Old Reader (http://theoldreader.com/) - Ino Reader (http://inoreader.com/)You need to register with the services to use this app.rss | atom | news | podcast | feedly | the old readerA simple, fast and powerful RSS client for Android, lets you to access your reading list and manage your subscriptions with ease from a native application, which is always in sync with the chosen reader service. It can also support listening to podcasts or downloading them for later use. Embedded videos cab be watched in-app if the device supports plugins (enable in preferences).Note: App features are limited to the chosen reader service*** This is an online reader; no offline reading is supported except the saved articles and podcasts.keywords: rss atom podcast feedly google reader news feed subscription share newspaper search podcast facebook twitter google+ old readerKey features-------------* Simple, functional and fast* No Lags what so ever* Supports Feedly cloud, The Old Reader* Utilizes low network traffic* Podcast support (download/play)* Mobilized articles* Add new subscription directly from the browser* Search for articles (depends on reader service support)* Feed discovery and subscription* Recommended articles (depends on reader service support)* Theme support (dark/light)* (Social) Sharing support (Google+, Facebook, Twitter, Email, Pocket (RIL), Readability, SMS and more)Features--------* Home (dashboard)  - Quick access links to different sections of the app  - Reading list/Subscriptions/Starred/Read items  - Recommended items  - Feed search  - Saved items  - Preferences  - Account switch* Subscriptions  - Clean and friendly subscriptions and labels/tags management  - Add new subscription (Using search or direct add)  - Remove subscription  - Add/Remove labels to/from subscriptions  - Rename label/tag    - Delete a label/tag  - Search for articles in labels/tags and subscriptions* Articles list   - Articles in a list format  - Filter articles: show all or new items (configure in preferences)  - Add/remove star (use swipe actions, if enabled)  - Mark as read or keep unread  - Mark multiple as read (all, visible or above items)    - Search for articles  - Swipe actions (set in preferences)  - Pocket/Readability support* Recommended items  - From chosen reader service  - Subscribe to interesting feeds from here * Article (full) view  - Better mobile readability and user experience (horizontal scrolling is not necessary for most articles)  - Navigate between articles using Nav bar, Swipe or Volume key: set in preferences  - One click add/remove star   - One click Keep-unread/Mark as read    - Share in Facebook, Google+, Twitter, Email or SMS   - Add to Pocket/Readability  - Mobilize original article (powered by Google/Instapaper/Readibility)  - View original article in browser  - Open any internal links within the in-app mobilizer (no need to leave the app)  - Save article (rss or mobilized) for offline reading  - listen to podcasts or download for later use  - Open Youtube videos in Youtube app  - Support for video playback (enable plugins in preferences)  - Full screen mode (PRO only)* Saved items  - a list of saved (in sd card) articles  - listen to downloaded podcasts* Home screen Widget  - Shows unread count  - Refresh interval can be configured  - Does not update when the phone is in stand by (save battery power when screen is off)* Set clear cache on exit (preferences) to save SD card space* And many more

reviews.title: Uninstalled. Search and save functions doesn\'t work.
reviews.comment: The search function,  in the article feed list don\'t work. When I press the button search nothing happens.     The \"save\" function in the article page doesn\'t work. Freezes the phone, and closes the app.      Samsung galaxy s4
reviews.author: Paco Vega

reviews.title: Fast and Functional
reviews.comment: Not the most \"beautiful\" app, but fast and functional. I first used it with Google Reader and have returned now that it supports InoReader. Sync is rock-solid, and the per-feed choice of mobilizer is a great feature.
reviews.author: Bill Waldron

reviews.title: Love this app!
reviews.comment: Best news reader on the market by far, just what it should be simple, fast and functional. If you follow a lot of RSS feeds you\'ll soon appreciate how much more efficiently you can keep up with everything using D7 than other more graphical readers on the market.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Awesome Google Reader replacement
reviews.comment: I have tried a lot of reader replacements when Google Reader was taken down, none has shown to be a good replacement but then D7 was updated to support feedly, i never had a second thought to go back to D7. It just works and it\'s fast!
reviews.author: Carl Saquitan

reviews.title: The fastest reader so far
reviews.comment: I\'ve switched to feedly after google reader retirement, but had hard time finding android app that works as good as old one on my ZTE Blade. It\'s the fastest one (pro version, bought just after few hours of using free, because of the promise to be even faster and lighter). Remarkable combination of features and nice UI. I really hope developer keeps it this way.
reviews.author: Aleksey Baibarin

reviews.title: Good app
reviews.comment: Thanks for the app updates!
reviews.author: Neil Browning

reviews.title: I keep coming back to this one
reviews.comment: Love the interface and how quick and reliable it is to go through my feeds. Sync is quick.  Only an occasional problem reading a feed, but it is more likely the article\'s fault than Reader\'s.  Maybe a way to switch between mobilizers in article view would be helpful.
reviews.author: Joel Konopa

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.comment: I\'m happy you survived the demise of the Google reader. Long live RSS!
reviews.author: Michael W

reviews.title: Just rught
reviews.comment: At last I\'ve found the perfect replacement for Google reader. It\'s so fast, easy and so reliable. Beats everything I\'ve tried. Also the developer is very quick to respond to emails. Full marks.
reviews.author: John Charles Hallett

reviews.title: Good!
reviews.comment: Use this for following all Feedly links except the photography links for which I use Feedly. D7 works fast without hiccups.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great job!
reviews.comment: Great job on the Feedly compatibility update! By far the best reader functionality wise on the market.
reviews.author: Allen Buckley

reviews.title: Thank you!
reviews.comment: for standing by your app and updating to make it compatible with Feedly! None of the other readers I tried measured up. Your hard work is very much appreciated. =)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: This is it
reviews.comment: Seek no more
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fast, clean interface
reviews.comment: Great work on update to feedly compatibility! D7 is much faster than other alternatives I have used, I missed the speed and the familiar interface the week I was without it.
reviews.author: Josh Gross

reviews.title: Outstanding
reviews.comment: I\'ve been using D7 for almost 2 years and is been a solid, fast and trouble free app. Just a joy to use every day. Highly recommended.  Awesome news that it works with Feedly now!
reviews.author: Tim Boysen

reviews.title: Feedly (F)ed it up
reviews.comment: used to work FLAWLESSLY, Great GUI, fast interaction. Have had this for years. Now after update, I can not read OR search any Feeds.
reviews.author: T. Schultz

reviews.title: Excellent work
reviews.comment: Fully support for Feedly after Google shutdown..
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fast and efficient
reviews.comment: My favourite reader because of the performance. Now in Feedly.. It\'s as if nothing changed!
reviews.author: David Zammit

reviews.title: Transparent change to Feedly
reviews.comment: I was pleasantly surprised to see this updated. It\'s still the same D7 reader, just with a different backend. Awesome!
reviews.author: Brad Hoeksema

reviews.title: The best RSS reader
reviews.comment: have been using G7 for almost 3 years.  good news the developer is going to make the app works with Feedly. Nice job!
reviews.author: Johnson F.
